chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
T: lattice
s2: Pred T
s1: Pred T

Goal:
s1 =p s2 -> sup s1 = sup s2

Premises:
Notation sup := @Lattice.sup
Pred = fun T : Type => T -> Prop : Type -> Type Arguments Pred _%type_scope
sup_mono : forall s1 s2 : Pred T, s1 <=p s2 -> sup s1 <== sup s2
Mem_map_inv : ?x \In [seq ?f i | i <- ?s] -> exists y : ?T, ?x = ?f y /\ y \In ?s where ?T : [T : lattice s1 : Pred T s2 : Pred T |- Type] ?T' : [T : lattice s1 : Pred T s2 : Pred T |- Type] ?f : [T : lattice s1 : Pred T s2 : Pred T |- ?T -> ?T'] ?x : [T : lattice s1 : Pred T s2 : Pred T |- ?T'] ?s : [T : lattice s1 : Pred T s2 : Pred T |- seq ?T]
Sub : forall x : ?T, ?P x -> ?sT where ?T : [T : lattice s1 : Pred T s2 : Pred T |- Type] ?P : [T : lattice s1 : Pred T s2 : Pred T |- pred ?T] ?sT : [T : lattice s1 : Pred T s2 : Pred T |- subType ?P]
Mem_cat : forall (T : Type) (x : T) (s1 s2 : seq T), x \In s1 ++ s2 < -> x \In s1 \/ x \In s2
In_split : forall (T : Type) (x : T) (s : seq_PredType T), x \In s -> exists s1 s2 : seq T, s = s1 ++ x :: s2
SubType : forall (sub_sort : Type) (val : sub_sort -> ?T) (Sub : forall x : ?T, ?P x -> sub_sort), (forall K : sub_sort -> Type, (forall (x : ?T) (Px : ?P x), K (Sub x Px)) -> forall u : sub_sort, K u) -> (forall (x : ?T) (Px : ?P x), val (Sub x Px) = x) -> subType ?P where ?T : [T : lattice s1 : Pred T s2 : Pred T |- Type] ?P : [T : lattice s1 : Pred T s2 : Pred T |- pred ?T]
cat = fun T : Type => fix cat (s1 s2 : seq T) {struct s1} : seq T := match s1 with | [::] => s2 | x :: s1' => x :: cat s1' s2 end : forall T : Type, seq T -> seq T -> seq T Arguments cat {T}%type_scope (_ _)%seq_scope
supP : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred T) (x : T), x \In s -> x <== sup s
lbot = fun T : lattice => sup Pred0 : forall T : lattice, T Arguments lbot {T}
supM : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred T) (x : T), (forall y : T, y \In s -> y <== x) -> sup s <== x
sup_closed = fun T : lattice => [Pred s | forall d : Pred_Class, d <=p s -> sup d \In s] : forall T : lattice, Simpl_Pred (Pred T) Arguments sup_closed {T}
Image_inj_eqmem : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (X1 X2 : Pred A), injective f -> [Image f i | i <- X1] =p [Image f i | i <- X2] -> X1 =p X2
subp_asym : forall (T : Type) (p1 p2 : Pred T), p1 <=p p2 -> p2 <=p p1 -> p1 =p p2
ImageEq : forall (A B : Type) (f1 f2 : A -> B) (X : Pred A), f1 =1 f2 -> [Image f1 i | i <- X] =p [Image f2 i | i <- X]
Mem_morhp : forall (T : Type) (pT : PredType T) (x y : pT), x <~> y -> x =p y
Lattice.mx_sup : forall T : poset, Lattice.mixin_of T -> Pred T -> T
fun_of_Pred : forall T : Type, Pred T -> T -> Prop
PredD = fun (T : Type) (p1 p2 : Pred T) => [Pred x | xPredD p1 p2 x] : forall T : Type, Pred T -> Pred T -> Simpl_Pred T Arguments PredD {T}%type_scope
PredI = fun (T : Type) (p1 p2 : Pred T) => [Pred x | xPredI p1 p2 x] : forall T : Type, Pred T -> Pred T -> Simpl_Pred T Arguments PredI {T}%type_scope
PredU = fun (T : Type) (p1 p2 : Pred T) => [Pred x | xPredU p1 p2 x] : forall T : Type, Pred T -> Pred T -> Simpl_Pred T Arguments PredU {T}%type_scope
ImageIm : forall (A B C : Type) (f1 : B -> C) (f2 : A -> B) (X : Pred A), [Image f1 i | i <- [Image f2 i | i <- X]] =p [Image (f1 \o f2) i | i <- X]
inf : forall T : lattice, Pred T -> T
SimplPred : forall T : Type, Pred T -> Simpl_Pred T
MemProp : forall T : Type, Pred T -> Mem_Pred T
Pred_of_Simpl : forall T : Type, Simpl_Pred T -> Pred T
sup_closure = fun (T : lattice) (s : Pred T) => [Pred p | forall t : Pred T, s <=p t -> t \In sup_closed -> p \In t] : forall T : lattice, Pred T -> Simpl_Pred T Arguments sup_closure {T}
subPoset : forall T : poset, Pred T -> poset
Preim = fun (T rT : Type) (f : T -> rT) (d : Pred rT) => [Pred x | xPreim f d x] : forall T rT : Type, (T -> rT) -> Pred rT -> Simpl_Pred T Arguments Preim {T rT}%type_scope _%function_scope
ImageU : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (X1 X2 : Pred A), [Image f i | i <- PredU X1 X2] =p [PredU [Image f i | i <- X1] & [Image f i | i <- X2]]
LatticeMixin : forall (T : poset) (mx_sup : Pred T -> T), (forall (s : Pred T) (x : T), x \In s -> x <== mx_sup s) -> (forall (s : Pred T) (x : T), (forall y : T, y \In s -> y <== x) -> mx_sup s <== x) -> Lattice.mixin_of T
